items.title: OSA
items.description:
Date: 7th January 1998. -- Filename: CGEND000.PCX.

Possible Descriptions:
1998/01/15
------------
Posting: Psi Testing - Naval scientists are experimenting with the development of a comprehensive course to stimulate latent psionic abilities, and need test subjects with high psionic potential.
After months of being poked, prodded, and probed, you blossom in psionic training!  Although not all of the experimental regimen is without side effects, your budding mental abilities will serve you well during your career.  Your ESP, Telepathy, and Projection skills go up by 3!

You won't find the OSA in any traditional military texts.  This 'black ops' group specializes in covert activities and plausible deniability.  The main focus here is on subversion and psionics rather than weapons training and combat.

Psi Dampening is the discipline that covers neutralization of enemy psionic abilities.
The Projection discipline is for out-of-body psionic abilities
Kinesis is the art of altering molecular structures.
The ESP displine allows the psionicist to extend their senses beyond the physical realm.
Physic allows one to influence biological energies.
Psi Parasitism allows you to drain psionic or physical energies from others.
Telekinesis is the art of manipulating matter at a distance.
Telepathy allows one to send and receive thoughts.
Serenity governs overall psi power usage and efficiency.

1997/12/19
------------

Posting: Politician - Is corruption your forte?  Then this is the job for you.
Black Ops?  There is no such thing.  Return to your home.

1997/12/18
------------
Mission: Release Virus - Overpopulation is a problem.  Help it out by releasing deadly biological agents from deadly cargo canisters. Blah blah blah.  Long message testing is here.  Ibbity bibbity boo, blah de blah and then some more blah-i-ness!
You make it into a major population center, and then release your deadly payload.  Millions of innocents suffer for your evil actions.  You gain 5 DEX points!

The Navy is a great place to be.  I love the navy.

1997/12/16
------------
This is a long message to test length of these strings.  Is that okay?  Well, it had better be, gosh darn it!  Really!  I mean it!

Special Ops?  There is no special ops.  Return to your home.

References of the following psi powers were found in the code (1997/12/12):
Psi Deaden, Psi Chaff, Astral Projection, Time Travel, Cyber-Psi, Dampen, Energy Shield, Shock, Clairvoyance, Clairaudience, Precognition, Healing, Cure Poison, Cure Radiation, Sense Aura, Psi Drain, Soma Drain, Psyche Drain, Cryokinesis, Pyrokinesis, Push, Pull, Levitate, Confuse, Decoy, Chameleon, Suggestion, Mind Terror, Control, Focus, Respect, Perspective, Balance.

items.title: Navy
items.description:
Date: 30th December 1997.
Filename: CGEND001.PCX.
Possible Descriptions:

1998/01/15
------------
Mission: Urban Pacification - Economic distress has caused several colonies to threaten independence.  A strong military presence is being established to maintain order.
Fighting is intense as rebellion spreads among the local populace during your assignment on the colony of New Haven.  On several occasions you are required to go into the streets to quell rioting and keep the peace.  Your squad is pinned down by heavy resistance forces, and suffers heavy casualties. You gain 3 points of heavy weapons skill, and 1 point of weapons repair.  Injuries suffered during the fighting cost you 1 point of END.

The Marines handle the roughest, toughest fighting in the modern military.  Although subtlety is not their forte, the quality of weapons training in the Marines is the best around.  A very small amount of technical and psionic training can be found, for specialty jobs.

1998/01/07
------------
Posting: Energy Weapons - High tech energy weapons require a length training period before soldiers are qualified to use them in the field.
Posting: Loser - You are a loser.  Need I say more?
Mission: Impossible - Don't even bother unless you are Tom Cruise and have explosive chewing gum.

1997/12/19
------------
Mission: Attack on CIA - Aliens have taken over the CIA.  Kill them.
Mission: Blow up Mars - test test test test test test test test test test10 test test test test test test test test test test20  test test test test test test test test test test30 test test test test test test test test test test40 test test test test test test test test test test50 test test test test test test test test test test60 test test test test test test test test test test70
Posting: Garbageman - Clean up other people's refuse.  What fun!

1997/12/16
------------
Mission: Blow up Mars - Teach those filty Martians a lesson they will never forget!

1997/11/26
------------
Join the Marines! Go places and kill people!  Do it for yer ma.

References of the following weapons were found in the code (1997/12/08):
Viper G9, Kord 5.9, Muerte 800 XL, Diablo 666 Hawk Automatic, Kord Sniper Rifle, DoomBringer Shotgun, Military Assault Rifle, Xygar A9, SmartShooter Rifle, HS-1138 'Falcon', Neural Aggravator, Plasma Gun, EMP Pulse Rifle, AK-4700 Laser, Concussion Grenade, Timer Grenade, Starflare Grenade, Smoke Grenade, EMP Grenade, Portable Launcher, Quantum Decelerator, Field Generator, Plasma Cannon.

items.title: Marines
items.description:
Date: 12th January 1998.
Filename: CGEND002.PCX.
Possible Descriptions:

1998/01/15
------------
Mission: Raiders - Disaffected mercenaries are raiding Earth colonies near the Opihuichi system.  Naval units will engage enemy vessels and board them to quell anarchy and lawlessness.

Mission: Ground Invasion - Naval shock units must be deployed to clear out a landing zone for establishing an HQ unit on Orion IV.

Posting: Energy Weapons - High tech energy weapons require a lengthy training period before soldiers are qualified to use them in the field.
Although not the most exciting duty in the Navy, your weapons training proves useful.  Endless hours on the practice range pay off, and your AGI increases by 2, and you gain 5 points of energy weapons skill.

Posting: Administration - A large organization like the Navy requires a complex bureaucracy, and talented administrators to run it.

Posting: Officer Training - The Navy's officers are the finest in the military, and they get that way through an intensive training program.

A tour of duty in the Navy isn't just hot-dogging around in the latest fighter jets.  Naval ground forces are deployed to a variety of extra-planetary targets and have to perform in a wide variety of military operations.  Training in the navy is the most well-rounded of all the services, with an even mix of weapons, technical, and psionic operations.
The Computer Hacking skill is used for many varieties of electronic larceny.
Weapons Repair is a key field skill for fixing damaged or jammed weapons.
Weapons Modification lets you jury-rig weapons for an extra punch.
Electronics Repair is essential for fixing damaged high-tech equipment.

1997/12/19
------------
Posting: Programmer - Spend your life indoors, and apart from pesky humans.

1997/12/16
------------
Posting: Programmer - Spend your life indoors, and apart from pesty humans.

items.title: Von Braun
items.description:
Date: 11th January 1998.
Filename: CGEND003.PCX.
This screen possibly appeared at the end of all three character generation paths.
Possible Descriptions:

1998/01/15
------------
Mission: Infiltrate the Von Braun - Naval High Command has a critical need for your skills to defuse a tricky situation on board the deep space craft 'Von Braun'.  The ship's commander has gone renegade and you are authorized to use any and all means to eliminate Captain Kurtz.  A squadron of marines will assist you in overcoming any defenses that the Captain may have established on board the ship.
You set out for the most eventful mission of your career...

Birth Traits:
Big Lug - You are a big, stupid lug.  Duh.  Need I say more?
Fast Metabolism - Your metabolism is super speedy, ya drug addicted freak!
Freaky Personality - You are a creepy mutant.  You'll be at home in LA, but no where else.

Miscellaneous code entries (1998/01/15):
Strength is a measurement of physical prowess.
Perception determines your awareness and likelihood of noticing small, important details and avoiding unseen dangers.
Endurance measures how much punishment you can take and how long you can keep going under adverse conditions.
Intelligence determines your overall mental ability, and governs the effectiveness of Psionic powers.
Agility is quickness and dexterity, being both fleet of foot and deft of hand.
Guns skill covers all normal slug-throwing one handed weapons.
Rifles skill covers proper usage of heavier, two-handed projectile weapons
The Energy Weapons skill is for the proper use of energy or plasma based weapons like the fusion welder.
Grenades skill covers safe and effective use of short-range explosives.
Heavy Weapons skill is vital for the proper use of advanced, experimental or high-tech weaponry.

Miscellaneous code entries (1998/01/12):
STR is nifty, PER is for seein stuff, END, INT, AGI,
Guns, Rifles, The Energy Weapons skill is for the proper use of energy or plasma based weapons like the fusion welder.
Grenades, Heavy Weapons, Psi Dampening, Projection, Kinesis, ESP, Physic, Psi Parasitism, Telekinesis, Telepathy, Serenity.
Computer Hacking, Weapons Repair, Weapons Modification, Electronics Repair.

items.title: Unknown Class Screen
items.description:
Date: 11th January 1998.
Filename: CGEND004.PCX.
Possible Descriptions:

1998/01/15
------------
Mission: Deep Space Patrol - A deep space tour of duty can be filled with dangerous hazards and exciting opportunities.
Months pass in deep space aboard the UNN Lexington, before you are called in to combat a band of spacefaring raiders!  Fortunately superior technology carries the day, and you rout the raiders after a few weeks of skirmishing.  You gain 3 points of energy weapons skill, 2 points of PER, and 2 points of END.

items.title: Summary
items.description:
Date: 12th January 1998.
Filename: CGENSUMM.PCX.
When the player was done building their character, this screen would let you see what points you had invested in your characters skillset and let you reassign points based on preference. The code for this menu system was commented out and never removed from the game itself.

items.title: Summary (Restored)
items.description: This screen, combined with code left over in the game and unused graphics, results in this screen layout. Space for a Name entry, Gender, Age are displayed at the top as well as a Point Pool. Points from this pool could be assigned to various skills to let the player further build their character.

items.title: Early / Beta Cutscenes

items.title: Unused Landing Sequence
items.description: This video can be found in the shipped version of the game, but is never used. It also shows a cut part of the level which is hidden in the final game behind a huge hanger door.

items.title: Unused Death Video
items.description:
Found in a build dated 20th May 1999.
This video looks to have been planned to be used when the player died, but was removed from the final game. The voice clip is from System Shock 1.

items.title: Beta Company Logo Video
items.description:
Found in a build dated 20th May 1999.
This video has the Looking Glass logo first and then simple text for the Irrational Games logo. The sound clip is from episode 6 of Aquaman: The Animated Series called The Atom: The House of Doom.

items.title: Early Starport Video
items.description:
Found in a build dated 20th May 1999.
A slightly different version of the starport video with a rougher animation.

items.title: Early Cutscene1 Video
items.description:
Found in a build dated 20th May 1999.
A slightly different version of the 'introductory' video with small differences.

items.title: Early Cutscene2 Video
items.description:
Found in a build dated 20th May 1999.
A slightly different version of the 'boarding the von braun' video with small differences and no text at the beginning.

items.title: Early Cutscene3 Video
items.description:
Found in a build dated 20th May 1999.
No final cutscene had been made at this point in development, but the video that is being used as a placeholder will please some Taffers.

items.title: Janice Polito
items.description: Unused or early lines from Janice Polito.

items.title: What's going on down there?
items.description: A calmer sounding Polito warning the player about being sucked into space.

items.title: Info Kiosks in your area
items.description: Polito telling the player they can use information kiosks to learn more about the environment as well as how to use keycards.

items.title: Don't be squeamish...
items.description: Polito teaching the player how to loot bodies for items.

items.title: This Power Cell is dead...
items.description: An alternate line about the first power cell in the game, but she refers to the vacuum shields in a different way.

items.title: Cyber upgrade stations
items.description: An alternate line about what cyber upgrade units are, what the player needs to use them, and what they can be spent on.

items.title: These Cybernetic Modules...
items.description: Another line from Polito talking about cybernetic modules and what to do with them.

items.title: Make sure you expend...
items.description: Another line from Polito talking about spending cybernetic modules.

items.title: That insipid computer...
items.description: An alternate voice clip of Polito referencing 'sub-elevators', including a more sinister ending than the final version of the e-mail.

items.title: Watts should have the code
items.description: An alternate voice clip of Polito talking about what to do about getting the Maintenance access code.

items.title: Power outage
items.description: An alternate voice clip of Polito talking about the second Power Cell. She doesn't refer to the first recharger being unavailable to the player now which is maybe why it was changed in the final version.

items.title: You can hack this Replicator...
items.description: Polito telling the player they can hack Replicators.

items.title: Find Dr Watts room
items.description: This clip has extra dialogue at the end that was removed in the final version.

items.title: Watts isn't here
items.description: A shorter alternate line about the keycard in Watts' quarters.

items.title: Do not waste time...
items.description: An alternate voice clip of Polito referencing 'sub-elevators'.

items.title: Found a Research soft yet?
items.description: An extended voice clip of Polito talking about Aux Storage 4, which mentions Research software.

items.title: I've opened an access tunnel...
items.description: Polito talks about opening up the access tunnel in Engineering, where the player encounters their first Cyborg Midwife.

items.title: Do not move!
items.description: Polito telling the player not to move. By the name of the sound file, this was used in a longer conversation that can be heard below.

items.title: Overgrown with matter
items.description: An alternate line talking about the bio-organic matter plugging up the elevator shaft.

items.title: They know where you are!
items.description: Polito telling the player about needing to clear the shaft.

items.title: Altered for the Xenomorphs
items.description: A line that reads the same as the original, but was prefixed with other information in the final version.

items.title: Material called Toxin-A
items.description: Polito telling the player to research the Toxin-A with the Research soft. In the final game, the player needs Research level 1 to do the same action.

items.title: Combat and Interaction Mode
items.description: Polito explains Shoot Mode and Use Mode, called Combat and Interaction Mode in this line.

Filename: GRHELP3.WAV

An omninous voice crying for help, possibly from a Hybrid.

items.title: Could you help me please?
items.description:
Filename: CS0301.WAV

This voice clip is found in the final game files but never used.  It may have been used on a removed Hybrid at the beginning of MedSci.

items.title: Enemies - Protocol Droid
items.description: Unused Protocol Droid sounds

items.title: Humming
items.description:
Filename: PD1AT0_5.WAV

The Protocol Droid humming a tune while walking around. Never used in the final game.

items.title: Running Away (1)
items.description:
Filename: PD1RUN_1.WAV

Enemies in System Shock 2 don't run away when at low health or if a target is out of range. This 'fleeing' voice line would be used for that situation.
